revision.text:
{{Infobox video game | title = Hand of Fate | image = Hand of fate cover art.png | developer = Defiant Development | publisher = Defiant Development | engine = [[Unity (game engine)|Unity]] | platforms = [[Linux]], [[Microsoft Windows]], [[OS X]], [[PlayStation 4]], [[Xbox One]] | released = 17 February 2015 | genre = [[Action role-playing game|Action role-playing]] | modes = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]] | director = | producer = | designer = | programmer = | artist = | writer = | composer = [[Jeff van Dyck]] }} '''''Hand of Fate''''' is an [[action role-playing game|action role-playing]] [[video game]] developed and published by Defiant Development for [[Linux]], [[Microsoft Windows]], [[OS X]], [[PlayStation 4]] and [[Xbox One]], released in February 2015. A [[PlayStation Vita]] version was announced but ultimately cancelled due to development issues.{{cite web|url=http://www.playstationlifestyle.net/2015/07/03/hand-of-fate-ps-vita-version-cancelled/|title=Hand of Fate PS Vita Version Cancelled|date=July 3, 2015|website=PlayStation Lifestyle}} ''Hand of Fate'' has the player work their way through randomized dungeons, generated by cards selected from customizable decks, to try to reach a final boss of each dungeon. Most of the game is played through an in-game tabletop tableau, with the player's actions narrated and executed by the mysterious Dealer, at times requiring the player to make choices to proceed. When combat occurs, the game switches to a third-person perspective brawler-style game, requiring the player to time attacks, blocks, dodges, and other abilities to defeat enemies without losing all their health. As the player progresses, they can earn tokens, which, upon completion of a dungeon (successfully or not), gain them additional cards that they can used to customize their decks for the next dungeon run. ''Hand of Fate'' received generally positive reviews, and led to the successful [[crowdfunding|crowdfunded]] physical variation of the game. A sequel, ''Hand of Fate 2'', was released in November 2017. ==Gameplay== ''Hand of Fate'' is an [[action role-playing game|action role-playing]] [[video game]] with [[roguelike]] and [[Deck-building game|deck-building]] elements. The player takes the role of a nameless hero that meets a strange Dealer voiced by Anthony Skordi, in a "cabin at the end of the world". This dealer narrates the player's adventure, dealing the game's cards, rewards, penalties, lore, and commentary. He also serves as the primary antagonist for the game. On starting a new game, the player is given a starting deck of cards, consisting of equipment, hero class, and encounter cards. The player earns more cards as they progress in the game, which they can use to customize their deck up to a fixed size. Furthermore, the dealer has his own deck from which surprising elements such as more challenging encounters and monsters are drawn that also grows as the player gains cards and progresses through the game. In the game's Story Mode, the player must defeat thirteen bosses: twelve court cards and the Dealer himself. These bosses, representing the royalty of each [[Suit (cards)|suit]], must be defeated in order, but the player can return to previous bosses to challenge again and unlock new rewards. After a certain number of these bosses are defeated, the player also unlocks Endless Mode, which provides an infinite number of "floors" of increasing difficulty for the player to challenge with every card they have collected up to that point. To progress in Story Mode, the player must complete a "dungeon" by exploring two or more "floors" created by a tableau of randomized, face-down encounter cards dealt from the combined deck of ''both'' player and Dealer. In addition to random encounters, each floor also includes either an exit encounter that lets the player reach the next floor, or a boss encounter on the final floor of that dungeon. The player starts with a limited amount of health, food, and initial equipment, modified by the player's selected class card and certain conditions obtained over the course of the story. To navigate each floor of the dungeon, the player moves a token across the tableau one card at a time, revealing it if face down. When each card is encountered, the Dealer narrates the event and resolves its effects. Events can include meeting non-player characters, shops to buy and sell cards that benefit the player for the remainder of that dungeon, enemy encounters, or chance events that may benefit or hinder the player. Some of these events include a tree of options that the player can choose, while chance is presented as four shuffled cards representing rates of success or failure. Each movement step consumes food, and certain events can cause the player to gain or lose health, food, gold, blessings, curses, or equipment. The latter three can augment the player's attack power, defensive power, health, speed, or provide special abilities or conditions both inside and out of combat. If the player encounters a monster or maze of traps, the number and type of enemy are determined by cards drawn by the Dealer (if any). The game then enters a third-person perspective action mode, where the player can attack, dodge, reflect and counterattack enemies and traps represented by the cards that were drawn. Damage taken is reflected in the player's overall health, which can be recovered normally with food or at certain shops and healers. On completing some encounters, the Dealer will present special tokens representing new cards that the player will receive at the conclusion of that dungeon, regardless of whether they won or were defeated. If the player's character loses all of their health (i.e., by encounter or starvation) or chooses to forfeit from the in-game menu, they lose that dungeon, and the board is reset after they receive their tokens. If the player successfully beats the dungeon's boss, they progress one step forward in the story. The Dealer awaits the player for the final showdown and confrontation, so the player must pay close attention to [[Deck-building game|deck-building]], strategy, tactics, and chance in order to succeed. ==Development== ''Hand of Fate'' was first shown at the 2013 [[Game Developers Conference]]. A playable demo build was shown to the public at [[PAX Australia]] in July 2013. By this point, the game had been in development for under six months.{{cite web | url=http://unity3d.com/showcase/case-stories/hand-of-fate | title=Roll Your Own | work=[[Unity (game engine)|Unity]] | date=January 5, 2015 | accessdate=April 19, 2015}}{{cite web| url=http://www.smh.com.au/digital-life/games/blogs/screenplay/hand-of-fate-brisbane-indie-talks-crowdfunding-design-and-inspiration-20131212-2z6uu.html| title=Screen Play: Hand of Fate: Brisbane indie talks crowdfunding, design, and inspiration| author=James Dominguez| work=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]]| date=2013-12-12| accessdate=2015-04-24}} Defiant Development are a team of approximately fifteen based in [[Brisbane]], they described ''Hand of Fate'' as their "first big push" onto PC platforms following their previous [[Mobile game|mobile projects]]. Like all other Defiant games, ''Hand of Fate'' is built in [[Unity (game engine)|Unity]].{{cite web| url=http://www.kotaku.com.au/2013/12/the-kickstarter-pitch-hands-of-fate/| title=The Kickstarter Pitch: Hands Of Fate| author=Mark Serrels| work=[[Kotaku|Kotaku Australia]]| date=2013-12-06| accessdate=2013-12-18}} The game was part funded through a [[Kickstarter]] crowdfunding campaign. It was one of the first Australian projects to launch on Kickstarter. The campaign launched in November 2013 and concluded in December 2013, achieving its {{AUD|50,000|link=yes}} target. Not only was the campaign a financial success, it also allowed Defiant to build an audience and get feedback on pre-release builds.{{cite web| url=http://www.pcauthority.com.au/News/363993,aussie-game-hand-of-fate-launches-on-kickstarter.aspx| title=Aussie game Hand of Fate launches on Kickstarter| author=David Hollingworth| work=[[Atomic (magazine)|Atomic]]| date=2013-11-13| accessdate=2015-04-24}}{{cite web| url=https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/defiant/hand-of-fate-a-card-game-that-comes-to-life/description| title=Hand of Fate, a card game that comes to life| author=Defiant Development| publisher=[[Kickstarter]]| date=2013-11-12| accessdate=2015-04-24}} A Greenlight campaign was launched simultaneously so that the game could be released on [[Steam (software)|Steam]], and the game was approved in January 2014.{{cite web | url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/updates/190389431/1384298233 | title=Hand of Fate is now on Kickstarter | work=Steam Community | first=Morgan | last=Jaffit | date=November 12, 2013 | accessdate=April 19, 2015}}{{cite web | url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/updates/190389431/1389138668 | title=We're Greenlit! | work=Steam Community | first=Morgan | last=Jaffit | date=January 14, 2014 | accessdate=April 19, 2015}} A week following the crowdfunding campaign, an [[Software release life cycle#Alpha|alpha build]] was released for Kickstarter backers.{{cite web | url=https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/defiant/hand-of-fate-a-card-game-that-comes-to-life/posts/701129 | title=Update #18 – Alpha is out | work=[[Kickstarter]] | date=December 20, 2013 | accessdate=April 19, 2015}} A beta version followed in February 2014, and in July, the game launched for Windows, OS X, and Linux on [[Steam Early Access]].{{cite web | url=https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/defiant/hand-of-fate-a-card-game-that-comes-to-life/posts/748555 | title=Update #24 – Beta is out! | work=[[Kickstarter]] | date=February 15, 2014 | accessdate=April 19, 2015}}{{cite web | url=https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/defiant/hand-of-fate-a-card-game-that-comes-to-life/posts/903319 | title=Update #31 – Steam Early Access is live! | work=[[Kickstarter]] | date=July 8, 2014 |accessdate=April 19, 2015}} The full version was released for Windows, OS X, Linux, PlayStation 4 and Xbox One on 17 February 2015.{{cite web | url=http://www.gameinformer.com/b/news/archive/2015/02/11/hand-of-fate-dealt-a-release-date.aspx | title=Hand Of Fate Dealt A Release Date | work=[[Game Informer]] | publisher=[[GameStop]] | first=Matt | last=Bertz | date=February 11, 2015 | accessdate=April 19, 2015}} A sequel, ''Hand of Fate 2'', had been announced with a planned early 2017 release, but was eventually first released on November 7, 2017 for personal computers and [[PlayStation 4]], with an [[Xbox One]] version to release shortly afterwards.{{cite web | url =http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2017-10-04-tabletop-fantasy-deck-builder-hand-of-fate-2-comes-to-pc-and-console-this-november | title = Tabletop fantasy deck-builder Hand of Fate 2 comes to PC and console this November | first = Matt | last = Wales | date = October 4, 2017 | accessdate = October 4, 2017 | work = [[Eurogamer]] }}{{cite press release | url = https://www.gamasutra.com/view/pressreleases/309178/Hand_of_Fate_2_Available_Now_for_PlayStation_4_PC.php | title = Hand of Fate 2 Available Now for PlayStation 4, PC | publisher = [[Gamasutra]] | date = November 7, 2017 | accessdate = November 9, 2017 }} The sequel will add more challenges that the player must meet to proceed in dungeons, stronger monsters to face in battle, and companions that can be gained during the adventure which assist the player in combat.{{cite web | url = http://www.shacknews.com/article/93930/hand-of-fate-2-coming-to-pc-mac-and-linux-in-q1-2017 | title = Hand of Fate 2 coming to PC, Mac, and Linux in Q1 2017 | work = [[Shacknews]] | first = Daniel | last = Perez | date = April 5, 2016 | accessdate = April 5, 2016 }} ''Hand of Fate 2'' will also release on the [[Nintendo Switch]] on July 17, 2018.{{cite web | url = https://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2018-07-09-dungeon-crawling-deck-builder-hand-of-fate-2-is-heading-to-switch | title = Dungeon-crawling deck-builder Hand of Fate 2 is heading to Switch | first = Matt | last = Wales | date = July 9, 2018 | accessdate = July 9, 2018 | work = [[Eurogamer]] }} ===Board game=== Defiant worked with the board game development company Rule & Make to transition the video game into a [[deck-building game]] called ''Hand of Fate: Ordeals''. The board game allows for one to four players to cooperatively work together to process through quests in a similar manner as the video game. They sought about $22,000 in crowd-funding for publication via a Kickstarter campaign in May 2017; the campaign surpassed its goal within a day, and ended with more than $360,000 pledged.{{cite web | url = https://www.kotaku.com.au/2017/05/hand-of-fate-board-game-passes-kickstarter-goal-in-a-day/ | title = Hand Of Fate Board Game Passes Kickstarter Goal In A Day | first = Alex | last = Walker | date = May 25, 2017 | accessdate = June 21, 2017 | work = [[Kotaku]] }} == Release == In July 2016, Defiant Development partnered with [[IndieBox]] to produce an exclusive, custom-designed, physical release of ''Hand of Fate''. This individually-numbered collector’s box included a themed [[USB flash drive|USB drive]] with [[Digital rights management|DRM]]-free copy of the game, official soundtrack, instruction manual, [[Steam (software)|Steam]] key, and several custom-made collectibles. ==Reception== {{Video game reviews | GR = (PC) 81.58%{{cite web |url=http://www.gamerankings.com/pc/814492-hand-of-fate/index.html |title=Hand of Fate for PC |publisher=[[GameRankings]] |accessdate=17 February 2015}}
(XONE) 79.75%{{cite web |url=http://www.gamerankings.com/xboxone/125456-hand-of-fate/index.html |title=Hand of Fate for Xbox One |publisher=[[GameRankings]] |accessdate=17 February 2015}}
(PS4) 79.28%{{cite web |url=http://www.gamerankings.com/ps4/124909-hand-of-fate/index.html |title=Hand of Fate for PlayStation 4 |publisher=[[GameRankings]] |accessdate=17 February 2015}} | MC = (XONE) 80/100{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/xbox-one/hand-of-fate |title=Hand of Fate for Xbox One Reviews |publisher=[[Metacritic]] |accessdate=17 February 2015}}
(PS4) 79/100{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/playstation-4/hand-of-fate |title=Hand of Fate for PlayStation 4 Reviews |publisher=[[Metacritic]] |accessdate=17 February 2015}}
(PC) 78/100{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/hand-of-fate |title=Hand of Fate for PC Reviews |publisher=[[Metacritic]] |accessdate=17 February 2015}} | GI = 8.75/10{{cite web |last=Tack |first=Daniel |date=16 February 2015 |url=http://www.gameinformer.com/games/hand_of_fate/b/pc/archive/2015/02/16/defiant-deals-a-winning-hand.aspx |title=Defiant Deals A Winning Hand - Hand of Fate - PC |publisher=[[Game Informer]] |accessdate=16 February 2015}} | GameRev = {{Rating|4.5|5}}{{cite web |last=Tan |first=Nick |date=17 February 2015 |url=http://www.gamerevolution.com/review/hand-of-fate |title=Hand of Fate Review |publisher=[[Game Revolution]] |accessdate=17 February 2015}} | GSpot = 7/10{{cite web |last=VanOrd |first=Kevin |date=26 February 2015 |url=http://www.gamespot.com/reviews/hand-of-fate-review/1900-6416038/ |title=Hand of Fate Review |publisher=26 February 2015}} | IGN = 7/10{{cite web |last=Johnson |first=Leif |date=20 February 2015 |url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2015/02/21/hand-of-fate-review |title=Hand of Fate Review |publisher=[[IGN]] |accessdate=20 February 2015}} | PCGUS = 73/100{{cite web |last=Marks |first=Tom |date=18 February 2015 |url=http://www.pcgamer.com/hand-of-fate-review/ |title=Hand of Fate review |publisher=[[PC Gamer]] |accessdate=18 February 2015}} }} ''Hand of Fate'' received positive reviews. Aggregating review websites [[GameRankings]] and [[Metacritic]] gave the Microsoft Windows version 81.58% based on 13 reviews and 78/100 based on 27 reviews, the Xbox One version 79.75% based on 12 reviews and 80/100 based on 11 reviews and the PlayStation 4 version 79.28% based on 18 reviews and 79/100 based on 15 reviews. The game sold about 400,000 copies across personal computers and consoles, and it was downloaded more than 1.5 million times as part of a free game promotion for [[Xbox Live]].{{Cite web | url = http://kotaku.com/hidden-gem-hand-of-fate-gets-a-sequel-early-next-year-1769166026 | title = Hidden Gem Hand of Fate Gets A Sequel Early Next Year | first = Stephan | last= Totilo | date = April 5, 2016 | accessdate = April 5, 2016 | work = [[Kotaku]] }} {{clear}} ==References== {{Reflist|2}} ==External links== * [http://defiantdev.com/ Defiant Development] [[Category:2015 video games]] [[Category:Action role-playing video games]] [[Category:Cancelled PlayStation Vita games]] [[Category:Crowdfunded video games]] [[Category:Kickstarter-funded video games]] [[Category:Linux games]] [[Category:MacOS games]] [[Category:PlayStation 4 games]] [[Category:Single-player video games]] [[Category:Steam Greenlight games]] [[Category:Unity (game engine) games]] [[Category:Video games developed in Australia]] [[Category:Video games scored by Jeff van Dyck]] [[Category:Windows games]] [[Category:Xbox One games]]

revision.comment: /* Background */Set inflation template to day first using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=March 2014}} [[File:Home zone in Wonford.jpg|thumb|350px|Entrance to a home zone in [[Wonford]]]] A '''home zone''' is a [[living street]] (or group of streets) as implemented in the [[United Kingdom]], which are designed primarily to meet the needs of [[pedestrian]]s, [[cyclist]]s, children and residents and where the speeds and dominance of the [[car]]s is reduced.
==History==
===Background=== Legislation was introduced by the [[Highway Act 1835]] which banned the playing of football and games on the highway<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rugbyfootballhistory.com/originsofrugby.htm|title=Origins of Rugby|work=Rugby Football History|accessdate=2010-04-14|quote="football for the common man was being suppressed, notably by the 1835 highways act which forbade the playing of football on highways and public land - which is where most games took place"}}</ref> with a maximum penalty of up to forty [[shillings]] (£{{formatnum:{{Inflation|UK|2|1835|2015|r=2}}}} as of 2015{{Inflation-fn|UK|df=y}}).<ref>[[#opsi1835|Parliament (1835)]] para 72</ref> In 1860 [[Taverner John Miller]], MP for Colchester reported to the House of Commons that in the previous year 44 children had been sent to prison in London and [[Middlesex]] for failure to pay fines for playing in the street, highlighting the case of a 12-year-old boy sent to prison for 5 days for playing [[rounders]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://hansard.millbanksystems.com/commons/1860/apr/20/observations|title=Observations|publisher=Hansard|quote=The House would be surprised to hear that under that Act, no fewer than forty-four children were sent to prison in the metropolis last year, and since the commencement of this year twenty-five had been sent to prison. He would mention particularly two or three of these cases. George Dunn, aged twelve years, was sent to gaol for five days for playing at a game called "rounders" in which the boys stood in a ring and knocked a hall from one to another.}}</ref> In 1925 [[Nancy Astor, Viscountess Astor|Nancy Astor]] MP noted in the Commons that "There is no more pitiable sight in life than a child which has been arrested for playing in the street".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://hansard.millbanksystems.com/commons/1926/apr/28/recreation-facilities-urban-areas#S5CV0194P0_19260428_HOC_361|title=RECREATION FACILITIES (URBAN AREAS)|work=Hansard|quote=There is no more pitiable sight in life than a child which has been arrested for playing in the street. Of all the pitiable sights that I have seen that is the most pitiable. Though these children may be fined, we stand convicted. The other night, I went to see 50 of these children, tiny children some of them, ranging from 10 years of age}},</ref> By 1935 over 2,000 young people under the age of seventeen are prosecuted for playing in the streets.<ref name=PlayStreetsInLondon>{{cite web|url=http://www.londonplay.org.uk/file/1333.pdf|archive-url=https://www.webarchive.org.uk/wayback/archive/20090729220406/http://www.londonplay.org.uk/file/1333.pdf|dead-url=yes|archive-date=2009-07-29|title=Play Streets in London timeline}}</ref>
In 1934 [[Leslie Hore-Belisha, 1st Baron Hore-Belisha|Leslie Hore-Belisha]] became Transport Minister and initiated a number of [[road safety]] schemes in response the rising number of [[Reported Road Casualties Great Britain|Road Casualties in Great Britain]]; these included the [[zebra crossing]] and a proposal to introduce play streets to the UK, which had been successfully operating in the USA.<ref name=PlayStreetsInLondon/> Following a trial of 200 Play Streets in [[Manchester]] and [[City of Salford|Salford]] from 1936, the Street Playground Act 1938 allowed councils to designate streets as playgrounds where games could be played.
In 1957 the Transport Minister was asked in the Commons if he was aware that playground streets regulations were being ignored and were frequently used by through traffic; the Minister responded saying that the size of Playground Streets signs had recently been increased in size to make them more prominent.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://hansard.millbanksystems.com/commons/1957/apr/03/play-streets#S5CV0568P0_19570403_HOC_134|title=Play Streets|quote=Mr. Page asked the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation whether he is aware of the dangers to children in streets designated as "play streets", when those streets are used by through traffic and whether he will take steps by means of the Highway Code or otherwise, to draw the attention of drivers to the fact 387 that it is an offence to drive a vehicle in a play street except when calling at premises in the street}}</ref> Play street legislation was included in section 49 of the Road Traffic Act 1960.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/Eliz2/8-9/16/section/49/enacted|title=Road Traffic Act 1960 Section 49 - Power of local authorities to prohibit traffic on roads to be used as playgrounds}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://hansard.millbanksystems.com/written_answers/1965/jun/29/play-streets#S5CV0715P0_19650629_CWA_90|title=Play Streets|work=Hansard|quote=Local authorities were advised in a Ministry of Transport Circular No. 787 dated 12th July, 1961, to consider using the powers to make Street Playground Orders under section 49 of the Road Traffic Act, 1960, as a contribution to the safety of children in urban areas where there is insufficient recreational space}}</ref>
By 1963 there were 750 such streets around the country,<ref name=Marles1963/> but there was also growing conflict between the needs of children and the needs of motorists. In that year [[Ernest Marples]], the Transport minister, was asked in the Commons if he could make a statement about the issue of car parking in play street; he responded by indicating that he had only occasionally received complaints about parking issues in play streets.<ref name=Marles1963>{{cite web|url=http://hansard.millbanksystems.com/written_answers/1963/jul/10/play-streets|title=Play Streets|quote=Mr. Spriggs asked the Minister of Transport what evidence he has of car parking in official play streets; and if he will make a statement on the working of the Street Playgrounds Act, 1938}}</ref> In the same year a petition was presented in the Commons from residents objecting to the illegal use of their playground street in Westminster being used by through-traffic and by people parking cars<ref>{{cite web|url=http://hansard.millbanksystems.com/commons/1963/aug/01/passmore-street-city-of-westminster|title=Passmore Street, City of Westminster|work=Hansard|quote=I wish to present a Petition to this honourable House on behalf of 20 residents in Passmore Street in the City of Westminster. The Petition relates that this is an official street playground, but children play there at risk of their lives because of the abuse by motorists, and parkers of cars}}</ref> By contrast, the minister was also questioned in the Commons about a recently approved Playgrounds Street Order for a number of streets in Newcastle which was reported to have been opposed by all residents.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://hansard.millbanksystems.com/written_answers/1963/aug/01/play-streets-newcastle-upon-tyne#S5CV0682P0_19630801_CWA_189|title=Play Streets, Newcastle-upon-Tyne|quote=Mr. R. W. Elliott asked the Minister of Transport whether he is aware that in confirming the Newcastle-upon-Tyne (Street Playgrounds) (No. 1) Order, 1963, he ignored the objections of nearly all of the residents of the three streets named in the order}}</ref> In 1976 [[Trevor Huddleston]], the [[Bishop of Stepney]] commented that Britain appeared to prefer motor cars to children ‘by cluttering up Play Streets with parked cars'.<ref name=PlayStreetsInLondon/> By the 1980s Playgrounds Streets had been largely forgotten; there were streets which retained the signage and accompanying traffic restrictions, however residents' parked cars left no space for play.<ref name=PlayStreetsInLondon/>
===Current legislation=== The main enabling legislation for home zones is given in section 268 of the [[Transport Act 2000]] which allows the creation of 'use orders' which are orders that 'permit the use of a road for purposes other than passage'.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2000/38/section/268|title=Transport Act 2000 Section 268}}</ref> In 2002 Farley Bank, a [[cul-de-sac]] in Hastings was designated as a Play Street giving children traffic-free space for play between 8am and sunset.<ref name=PlayStreetsInLondon/>
Further guidelines relating to England in circular 02/2006: 'The Quiet Lanes and Home Zones (England) Regulations 2006'.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dft.gov.uk/pgr/sustainable/homezones/circular22006thequietlanesan5740?version%3D1|title=circular22006thequietlanesan5740|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070130011647/http://www.dft.gov.uk/pgr/sustainable/homezones/circular22006thequietlanesan5740?version=1|archivedate=30 January 2007|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
==Principles== {{Refimprove section|date=July 2012}} These principles are similar to those of the ''[[shared space]]'' type schemes, which apply also to a wider range of environments and follow closely the pattern of the Dutch [[woonerf]] schemes.
Encouraging children's play is an important aim of many home zone schemes. Home zones have a very good safety record, but are not primarily designed as road safety schemes.
Home zones are encouraged by the UK Government as part of new residential areas. Although it is not possible for prospective residents to be involved in the design of new streets, steps can be taken to involve them in their maintenance and management. Residents must be need to be consulted by the local Traffic Authority on the precise uses that can take place on the street (specified through a 'Use Order') and the appropriate speed of traffic on the street (specified through a 'Speed Order') before the home zone can be legally designated and signed.
Home zones often involved the use of shared space, where the street is not strongly divided into exclusive pedestrian and traffic areas. Concerns have been expressed over the inability of blind and partially sighted people to use shared space streets. Providing a clear route for pedestrians that is kept free of traffic, by using street furniture for example, is one way of meeting the needs of the visually impaired.
Well-designed home zones often include features such as benches, tables and play equipment to encourage social interaction. Street trees and areas of planting, ideally maintained by residents, will often feature. On-street parking also forms part of the layout in most schemes.
Traffic speeds are kept low - with a typical target speed being around 20 km/h (10-15 mph) - through the overall design of the street and features such as sharp changes of direction for traffic and narrowings where only one motor vehicle can pass at a time. Traditional [[traffic calming]] features such as road humps can also be used, but should be integrated into the design rather than being added as an engineered afterthought.
Examples of UK practice include [[Staiths South Bank]] in [[Gateshead]], which at over 600 homes was the largest newbuild home zone development in the UK at the time it received planning consent. Most contemporary UK schemes have involved public realm works to existing streets in older Victorian housing areas, often to meet regeneration or traffic calming objectives.
== References == {{reflist}}
== External links == * Biddulph M (2001) Home Zones: A planning and design handbook, Bristol, Policy Press * Biddulph M (2010) Evaluating the English Home Zones Initiative, Journal of the American Planning Association, Vol 76(2) * Department for Transport (2005) Home Zones: Challenging the future of our streets, London DfT * Institute of Highway and Incorporated Engineers (2002) Home Zone Design Guidelines, London IHIE * [http://www.homezones.org.uk/ Homezones.org.uk] The Home Zones page of the Institute of Highway Incorporated Engineers ** [http://www.homezones.org.uk/public/resources/documents/CanIplayout.pdf Can I play out? Lessons from London Play’s Home Zones project] A report by Tim Gill * [http://hansard.millbanksystems.com/acts/street-playgrounds-act-1938 Street Playgrounds Act 1938] * [https://www.webarchive.org.uk/wayback/archive/20090729220406/http://www.londonplay.org.uk/file/1333.pdf History of playground streets in London] * [http://www.streetparty.org.uk http://www.streetparty.org.uk] * [http://www.streetsalive.net http://www.streetsalive.net]
[[Category:Living streets]] [[Category:Types of streets]] [[Category:Transport in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Cycling in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Walking in the United Kingdom]]

revision.comment: /* Timeline of human image synthesis */ + In 2018 at the [[World Internet Conference]] in [[Wuzhen]] the [[Xinhua News Agency]] presented two digital look-alikes made to the resemblance of its real news anchors Qiu Hao ([[Chinese language]]) and Zhang Zhao ([[English language]]). + 2 ref
revision.text:
'''Human image synthesis''' can be applied to make believable and even [[photorealism|photorealistic]] renditions<ref>[http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/Xplore/login.jsp?url=/iel3/4294/12363/00568819.pdf?arnumber=568819 Physics-based muscle model for mouth shape control] on ''[[IEEE]] Explore'' (requires membership)</ref><ref>[http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/Xplore/login.jsp?url=/iel3/3988/11478/00531968.pdf?arnumber=531968 Realistic 3D facial animation in virtual space teleconferencing] on ''[[IEEE]] Explore'' (requires membership)</ref> of human-likenesses, moving or still. This has effectively been the situation since the early [[2000s (decade)|2000s]]. Many films using [[computer generated imagery]] have featured synthetic images of human-like characters [[digital compositing|digitally composited]] onto the real or other simulated film material.
[[File:BSDF05 800.png|thumb|right|300px|[[Bidirectional scattering distribution function]] (BSDF) for human skin likeness requires both [[Bidirectional reflectance distribution function|BRDF]] and special case of BTDF where [[subsurface scattering|light enters the skin, is transmitted and exits the skin]].]]
== Timeline of human image synthesis == {{main|History of computer animation|Timeline of computer animation in film and television}} * '''In 1971''' [[Henri Gouraud (computer scientist)|Henri Gouraud]] made the first [[Computer graphics|CG]] [[geometry]] [[digitization|capture]] and representation of a human face. Modeling was his wife Sylvie Gouraud. The 3D model was a simple [[wire-frame model]] and he applied [[Gouraud shading|the Gouraud shader he is most known for]] to produce the first known representation of human-likeness on computer [http://interstices.info/jcms/c_25256/images-de-synthese-palme-de-la-longevite-pour-lombrage-de-gouraud (view images)].<ref>{{cite web|title=Images de synthèse : palme de la longévité pour l’ombrage de Gouraud|url=http://interstices.info/jcms/c_25256/images-de-synthese-palme-de-la-longevite-pour-lombrage-de-gouraud}}</ref> * The '''1972''' short film ''[[A Computer Animated Hand]]'' by [[Edwin Catmull]] and [[Fred Parke]] was the first time that [[computer-generated imagery]] was used in film to simulate moving human appearance. The film featured a computer simulated hand and face [http://vimeo.com/16292363 (watch film here)]. * The '''1976''' film ''[[Futureworld]]'' reused parts of ''A Computer Animated Hand'' on the big screen. * The '''1983''' [[Musique Non-Stop#Music video|music video for song Musique Non-Stop]] by German band [[Kraftwerk]] aired in 1986. Created by the artist [[Rebecca Allen (artist)|Rebecca Allen]], it features non-realistic looking, but clearly recognizable computer simulations of the band members. * The '''1994''' film [[The Crow (1994 film)|The Crow]] was the first film production to make use of digital compositing of a computer simulated representation of a face onto scenes filmed using a [[body double]]. Necessity was the muse as the actor [[Brandon Lee]] portraying the protagonist was tragically killed accidentally on-stage. * In '''[[SIGGRAPH]] 2000''' [[Paul Debevec]] et al. of [[University of Southern California|USC]] presented a method to capture the reflectance field over the human face with their first version of a [[light stage]].<ref name="Deb2000"/> [[File:BSSDF01_400.svg|thumb|right|300px|BRDF vs. subsurface scattering inclusive BSSRDF i.e. [[Bidirectional scattering distribution function#Overview of the BxDF functions|Bidirectional scattering-surface reflectance distribution function]]]] * In '''2003''' [[audience]] debut of photo realistic human-likenesses in the 2003 films ''[[The Matrix Reloaded]]'' in [[The Matrix Reloaded#Visual effects|the burly brawl sequence]] where up-to-100 [[Agent Smith]]s fight [[Neo (The Matrix)|Neo]] and in ''[[The Matrix Revolutions]]'' where at the start of the end showdown Agent Smith's [[cheekbone]] gets punched in by Neo leaving the digital look-alike unnaturally unhurt. The Matrix Revolutions bonus [[DVD]] documents and depicts the process in some detail and the techniques used, including [[facial motion capture]] and [[Limb (anatomy)|limb]]al [[motion capture]], and [[wikt:projection|projection]] onto models. * In '''2003''' [[The Animatrix#Final Flight of the Osiris|''The Animatrix: Final Flight of the Osiris'']] a [[state-of-the-art]] want-to-be human likenesses not quite fooling the watcher made by [[Square Pictures#Square Pictures|Square Pictures]]. * In '''2003''' digital likeness of [[Tobey Maguire]] was made for movies ''[[Spider-man 2]]'' and ''[[Spider-man 3]]'' by [[Sony Pictures Imageworks]].<ref name="Pig2005">{{cite web | last = Pighin | first = Frédéric | author-link = | title = Siggraph 2005 Digital Face Cloning Course Notes | work = | publisher = | date = | url = http://pages.cs.wisc.edu/~lizhang/sig-course-05-face/COURSE_9_DigitalFaceCloning.pdf | format = | doi = | accessdate = 2017-05-24}} </ref> * In '''2009''' Debevec et al. presented new digital likenesses, made by [[Image Metrics]], this time of actress [[Emily O'Brien]] whose reflectance was captured with the USC light stage 5<ref name="Deb2009">[http://www.ted.com/talks/paul_debevec_animates_a_photo_real_digital_face.html In this TED talk video] at 00:04:59 you can see ''two clips, one with the real Emily shot with a real camera and one with a digital look-alike of Emily, shot with a simulation of a camera - <u>Which is which is difficult to tell</u>''. Bruce Lawmen was scanned using USC light stage 6 in still position and also recorded running there on a [[treadmill]]. Many, many digital look-alikes of Bruce are seen running fluently and natural looking at the ending sequence of the TED talk video.</ref> Motion looks fairly convincing contrasted to the clunky run in the [[Animatrix#Final Flight of the Osiris|''Animatrix: Final Flight of the Osiris'']] which was [[state-of-the-art]] in 2003 if photorealism was the intention of the [[animators]]. * In '''2009''' a digital look-alike of a younger [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]] was made for the movie ''[[Terminator Salvation]]'' though the end result was critiqued as unconvincing. Facial geometry was acquired from a 1984 mold of Schwarzenegger. * In '''2010''' [[Walt Disney Pictures]] released a sci-fi sequel entitled ''[[Tron: Legacy]]'' with a digitally rejuvenated digital look-alike of actor [[Jeff Bridges]] playing the [[antagonist]] [[List of Tron characters#CLU|CLU]]. *In '''SIGGGRAPH 2013''' [[Activision]] and USC presented a [[real time computing|real time]] "Digital Ira" a digital face look-alike of Ari Shapiro, an ICT USC research scientist,<ref name="reform_youtube2015"> {{cite AV media | people = | title = ReForm - Hollywood's Creating Digital Clones | medium = youtube | publisher = The Creators Project | location = | date = 2017-05-24 | url = https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lTC3k9Iv4r0 }}
</ref> utilizing the USC light stage X by Ghosh et al. for both reflectance field and motion capture.<ref name="Deb2013">{{cite web | last = Debevec | first = Paul | title = Digital Ira SIGGRAPH 2013 Real-Time Live | work = | publisher = | date = | url = http://gl.ict.usc.edu/Research/DigitalIra/ | format = | doi = | accessdate = 2017-05-24}} </ref> The end result both precomputed and real-time rendering with the modernest game [[Graphics processing unit|GPU]] shown [http://gl.ict.usc.edu/Research/DigitalIra/ here] and looks fairly realistic. * In '''2014 The Presidential Portrait''' by USC [[Institute for Creative Technologies|ICT]] in conjunction with the [[Smithsonian Institution]] was made using the latest USC mobile light stage wherein President [[Barack Obama]] had his geometry, textures and reflectance captured.<ref name="USC2014"> {{cite web | last = | first = | authorlink = | title = Scanning and printing a 3D portrait of President Barack Obama | work = | publisher = University of Southern California | year = 2013 | url = http://gl.ict.usc.edu/Research/PresidentialPortrait/ | accessdate = 2017-05-24 }} </ref>
* For the '''2015''' film ''[[Furious 7]]'' a digital look-alike of actor [[Paul Walker]] who died in an accident during the filming was done by [[Weta Digital]] to enable the completion of the film.<ref name="thr2015"> {{cite web | url = http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/behind-screen/furious-7-how-peter-jacksons-784157 | title = 'Furious 7' and How Peter Jackson's Weta Created Digital Paul Walker | last = Giardina | first = Carolyn | date = 2015-03-25 | website = | work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] | access-date = 2017-05-24 | quote = }} </ref> * In '''2016''' techniques which allow [[Real-time computing#Near real-time|near real-time]] [[forgery|counterfeiting]] of [[facial expressions]] in existing 2D video have been believably demonstrated.<ref name="Thi2016">{{cite web | last = Thies | first = Justus | author-link = | title = Face2Face: Real-time Face Capture and Reenactment of RGB Videos | work = | publisher = Proc. Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (CVPR), IEEE | year = 2016 | url = http://www.graphics.stanford.edu/~niessner/thies2016face.html | doi = | accessdate = 2017-05-24}} </ref> * In '''2016''' a digital look-alike of [[Peter Cushing]] was made for the ''[[Rogue One]]'' film where its appearance would appear to be of same age as the actor was during the filming of the original 1977 ''[[Star Wars (film)|Star Wars]]'' film. * In '''SIGGRAPH''' '''2017''' an audio driven digital look-alike of upper torso of Barack Obama was presented by researchers from [[University of Washington]]. [http://grail.cs.washington.edu/projects/AudioToObama/ (view)] It was driven only by a voice track as source data for the animation after the training phase to acquire [[lip sync]] and wider facial information from [[training material]] consisting 2D videos with audio had been completed.<ref name="Suw2017">{{Citation | last = Suwajanakorn | first = Supasorn | author-link = | last2 = Seitz | first2 = Steven | author2-link = | last3 = Kemelmacher-Shlizerman | first3 = Ira | author3-link = | title = Synthesizing Obama: Learning Lip Sync from Audio | publisher = [[University of Washington]] | date = | year = 2017 | url = http://grail.cs.washington.edu/projects/AudioToObama/ | access-date = 2018-03-02 }} </ref> * Late '''2017'''<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://variety.com/2018/digital/news/deepfakes-porn-adult-industry-1202705749/|title=Porn Producers Offer to Help Hollywood Take Down Deepfake Videos|last=Roettgers|first=Janko|date=2018-02-21|work=Variety|access-date=2018-02-28|language=en-US}}</ref> and early '''2018''' saw the surfacing of the [[deepfake]]s controversy where [[Pornographic film|porn video]]s were doctored utilizing [[deep learning|deep machine learning]] so that the face of the actress was replaced by the software's opinion of what another persons face would look like in the same pose and lighting. * In '''2018''' '''[[Game Developers Conference|GDC]]''' [[Epic Games]] and [[Tencent Games]] demonstrated "Siren", a digital look-alike of the actress [[Bingjie Jiang]]. It was made possible with the following technologies: [[CubicMotion]]'s [[computer vision]] system, [[3Lateral]]'s facial rigging system and [[Vicon]]'s motion capture capture system. The demonstration ran in near real time at 60 frames per second in the [[Unreal Engine#Unreal Engine 4|Unreal Engine 4]].<ref name="venturebeat2018"> {{cite web | url = https://venturebeat.com/2018/03/21/epic-games-shows-off-amazing-real-time-digital-human-with-siren-demo/ | title = Epic Games shows off amazing real-time digital human with Siren demo | last = Takahashi | first = Dean | date = 2018-03-21 | website = | work= [[VentureBeat]] | access-date = 2018-09-10 | quote = }} </ref> * In '''2018''' at the [[World Internet Conference]] in [[Wuzhen]] the [[Xinhua News Agency]] presented two digital look-alikes made to the resemblance of its real news anchors Qiu Hao ([[Chinese language]])<ref name="TheGuardian2018"> {{cite web | url = https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/nov/09/worlds-first-ai-news-anchor-unveiled-in-china | title = World's first AI news anchor unveiled in China | last = Kuo | first = Lily | date = 2018-11-09 | website = | work = | access-date = 2018-11-09 | quote = }} </ref> and Zhang Zhao ([[English language]]). The digital look-alikes were made in conjunction with [[Sogou]].<ref name="BusinessInsider2018"> {{cite web | url = https://businessinsider.com/ai-news-anchor-created-by-china-xinhua-news-agency-2018-11 | title = China created what it claims is the first AI news anchor — watch it in action here | last = Hamilton | first = Isobel Asher | date = 2018-11-09 | website = | work = | access-date = 2018-11-09 | quote = }} </ref> Neither the [[speech synthesis]] used nor the gesturing of the digital look-alike anchors were good enough do deceive the watcher to mistake them for real humans imaged with a TV camera.
== Key breakthrough to photorealism: reflectance capture == In [[SIGGRAPH]] 2000 [[Paul Debevec]] et al. of USC presented their method to [[reflectance capture|capture the reflectance field]] with their extremely simple [[light stage]].<ref name="Deb2000">{{cite web | last = Debevec | first = Paul | author-link = Paul Debevec | title = Acquiring the reflectance field of a human face | work = | publisher = ACM | year = 2000 | url = http://dl.acm.org/citation.cfm?id=344855 | format = | doi = 10.1145/344779.344855 | accessdate = 2017-05-24}} </ref>
The scientific breakthrough required finding the [[subsurface scattering|subsurface light component]] (the simulation models are glowing from within slightly) which can be found using knowledge that light that is reflected from the oil-to-air layer retains its [[Polarization (waves)|polarization]] and the subsurface light loses its polarization. So equipped only with a movable light source, movable video camera, 2 polarizers and a computer program doing extremely simple math and the last piece required to reach photorealism was acquired.<ref name="Deb2000"/>
For a believable result both light [[Reflection (computer graphics)|reflected]] from skin ([[Bidirectional reflectance distribution function|BRDF]]) and within the skin (a special case of [[Bidirectional transmittance distribution function|BTDF]]) which together make up the [[bidirectional scattering distribution function|BSDF]] must be captured and simulated.
== Capture == [[File:VIUscan handheld 3D scanner in use.jpg|thumb|360px|right|Hand held [[3D scanning|three-dimensional scanner]].]] * The 3D [[geometry]] and [[texture mapping|textures]] are captured onto a [[3D computer graphics|3D]] [[computer model|model]] by [[Sampling (signal processing)|sampling]] the target by means of [[3D scanning]] with an [[RGB]] [[Cartesian coordinate system|XYZ]] scanner such as [[Arius3d]] or [[Cyberware (company)|Cyberware]] (textures from photos, not pure RGB XYZ scanner), [[Photogrammetry#Stereophotogrammetry|stereophotogrammetrically]] from [[multi-camera setup|synchronized photos]] or even from enough repeated non-simultaneous [[photography|photos]]. * For believable results also the [[reflectance field]] must b.e captured or an approximation must be picked from the libraries to form a 7D reflectance model of the target.
== Synthesis == The whole process of making digital look-alikes i.e. characters so lifelike and realistic that they can be passed off as pictures of humans is a very complex task as it requires photorealistically [[3D modeling|modeling]], [[animating]], [[cross-mapping]], and [[3D rendering|rendering]] the [[soft body dynamics]] of the human appearance.
Synthesis with an [[actor]] and suitable [[algorithm]]s is applied using powerful [[computer]]s. The actor's part in the synthesis is to take care of mimicking human [[Facial expression|expressions]] in still picture synthesizing and also human movement in [[motion picture]] synthesizing. Algorithms are needed to simulate laws of [[physics]] and [[physiology]] and to map the models and their appearance, movements and interaction accordingly.
Often both [[physics]]/[[physiology]] based (i.e. [[skeletal animation]]) and [[image-based modeling and rendering]] are employed in the synthesis part. Hybrid models employing both approaches have shown best results in realism and ease-of-use.
Using [[displacement mapping]] plays an important part in getting a realistic result with fine detail of skin such as [[Sweat gland|pore]]s and [[wrinkle]]s as small as 100 [[micrometre|µm]].
== Applications ==
Main applications fall within the domains of [[virtual cinematography]], computer and [[video games]] and [[covert]] [[disinformation]] [[Offensive (military)|attack]]s.
Furthermore, some research suggests that it can have [[Therapy|therapeutic effects]] as "[[psychologist]]s and [[Mental health counselor|counselor]]s have also begun using [[avatar (computing)|avatars]] to deliver therapy to clients who have [[phobias]], a history of [[Trauma (psychology)|trauma]], [[addiction]]s, [[Asperger’s syndrome]] or [[social anxiety]]."<ref name="Mur2011"/> The strong memory imprint and brain activation effects caused by watching a digital look-alike avatar of yourself is dubbed the [[doppelgänger effect]].<ref name="Mur2011"> {{cite web | last = Murphy | first = Samantha | author-link = | title = Scientific American: Your Avatar, Your Guide | work = | publisher = Scientific American / Uni of Stanford | year = 2011 | url = https://vhil.stanford.edu/mm/2011/sciam-your-avatar.pdf | format = .pdf | doi = | accessdate = 2013-06-29}} </ref> The doppelgänger effect can heal when covert disinformation attack is exposed as such to the targets of the attack.
== Related issues == The [[speech synthesis]] is verging on being completely indistinguishable from a real human's voice with the 2016 introduction of audio generation software [[Adobe Voco]], a prototype slated to be a part of the [[Adobe Creative Suite]] and [[DeepMind WaveNet]], a prototype from [[Google]].<ref name=deepmind.com2016> {{cite web |url= https://deepmind.com/blog/wavenet-generative-model-raw-audio/ |title= WaveNet: A Generative Model for Raw Audio |last= |first= |date= 2016-09-08 |website= Deepmind.com |publisher= |access-date= 2017-05-24 |quote= }} </ref> Ability to steal and manipulate other peoples voices raises obvious ethical concerns. <ref name=BBC2016>{{cite web |url= https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-37899902 |title= Adobe Voco 'Photoshop-for-voice' causes concern |last= |first= |date= 2016-11-07 |website= [[BBC.com]] |publisher= [[BBC]] |access-date= 2016-07-05 |quote= }} </ref>
This coupled with the fact that (as of 2016) techniques which allow [[Real-time computing#Near real-time|near real-time]] [[forgery|counterfeiting]] of [[facial expressions]] in existing 2D video have been believably demonstrated increases the stress on the disinformation situation.<ref name=Thi2016/>
== See also == * [[Motion-capture acting]] * [[Internet manipulation]] * [[Propaganda techniques]]
== References == {{reflist}}
[[Category:Simulation]] [[Category:Computer graphics]] [[Category:Pornography]] [[Category:Forgery controversies]] [[Category:Propaganda techniques]] [[Category:Special effects]]

revision.text:
{{Refimprove|date=November 2017}}{{Infobox product | image = [[File:Kakao Friends Wordings.png]]

[[File:Kakao Friends Paste Paper.png|250px]] | caption = Lineup of the characters figures | type = Characters | inventor = | inception = November 2012 | manufacturer = [[Kakao]] | available = Yes | url = {{URL|https://www.kakaofriends.com/en/index|kakaofriends.com}} }} '''Kakao Friends''' (stylized as '''KAKAO FRIENDS''') are featured characters based on [[KakaoTalk]] [[emoticons]] released in November 2012 by [[Kakao]], managed by their subsidiary '''Kakao Friends Corporation'''. The company carries out character related businesses.{{Cite news|url=http://navercast.naver.com/magazine_contents.nhn?rid=1103&rid=&contents_id=56451|title=카카오톡&라인 연대기 - 같은 듯 다른 두 앱의 길을 돌아보다|access-date=2017-05-30|language=ko}}{{Cite news|url=http://news.mk.co.kr/newsRead.php?no=1102330&year=2015|title=`카카오프렌즈` 탄생 세돌…조항수 대표 대한민국 대표 캐릭터 만들 것|work=mk.co.kr|access-date=2017-05-30|language=ko}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.hankyung.com/news/app/newsview.php?aid=2015042665531|title=카카오프렌즈 독립…캐릭터사업 승부수|date=2015-04-26|work=hankyung.com|access-date=2017-05-30|language=ko}} The character illustrator is Kwon Soon-ho, also known by his pen name Hozo.{{Cite news|url=http://navercast.naver.com/magazine_contents.nhn?rid=1089&contents_id=82701|title=카카오톡 캐릭터 디자이너를 만나다|access-date=2017-05-30|language=ko}} Kakao Friends has been used in various products and commercials, and has gained popularity and have become beloved characters in South Korea.{{Cite news|url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20170419000702|title=Kakao Friends become most beloved characters in Korea|last=|first=|date=2017-04-19|work=The Korea Herald News|access-date=2017-11-08|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=en}} == Characters == [[File:Kakao Friends RYAN.png|thumb|183x183px|Ryan of ''Kakao Friends'']] [[File:Kakao Friends Dolls.png|thumb|184x184px|Kakao Friends dolls]] Kakao Friends characters were developed in about two months after the idea meeting in July 2012 began. The Kakao Friends manager stated that he created these characters to make the KakaoTalk IM service easy and fun for the public.{{Cite news|url=http://bizn.khan.co.kr/khan_art_view.html?artid=201310241432401&code=930100&med=khan|title=카톡 이모티콘 ‘노란 토끼’가 단무지라고?…카카오 프렌즈 뒷이야기|access-date=2017-05-30|language=ko}} ===Muzi series === *'''Muzi''': Curious and playful, Muzi is actually a piece of [[takuan]] (also known as Danmuji in Korean) in rabbit clothes.{{Cite news|url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20160527000755|title=Pictures speak louder than words|last=|first=|date=2016-05-27|work=The Korea Herald News|access-date=2017-11-08|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=en}} HOZO stated that he thought of a takuan while thinking about a character that could represent the colors yellow and brown, which are the corporate colors of [[KakaoTalk]]. * '''Con''': Con, who looks like a small crocodile, is the one who raised Muzi.{{Cite web|url=http://www.manilatimes.net/kakao-friend/129951/|title=Which Kakao friend are you?|last=|first=|date=September 27, 2014|website=The Manila Times|language=en-US|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2017-11-08}} HOZO stated that Con is a character with a lot of secrets, always showing only the side of his face. The name Con is a combination of Crocodile and the korean word 콩알(pronounced as kongal), which means 'small'. *'''Apeach''': Apeach has the setting of escaping from a peach tree after learning that he became [[monoecious]] due to a genetic modification. They are a playful character, and also an adolescent character in their late teens to early twenties. * '''Jay-G:''' Jay-G is a mole character who was sent to find a rabbit's liver as an agent from the underground country. So, he chases after Muzi for his (or her) liver. He apparently renamed himself Jay-G, after looking up to the American hip-hop artist, [[Jay-Z]]. === Frodo series === * '''Frodo''': Frodo is a rich-born dog from the city. He has a complex that he is a mixed-blooded dog. He usually wears a red dog collar or a tie. Frodo is officially a couple with Neo, the cat character, and shows affection. * '''Neo''': Neo is a cat character with a bob cut wig and she is the lover of Frodo. The company stated that Neo is the representative fashionista of the Kakao friends characters who love shopping. * '''Tube''': Tube is a cowardly, weak-minded duck. He has the complex for his small feet so he wears flippers. If he feels extreme fear or anger, he spits fire out of his mouth and turns into a crazy green duck. === Ryan series=== * '''Ryan''': The character named Ryan was newly announced on January 22, 2016. At first glance, he looks like a bear but he is a lion that doesn’t have a mane. Ryan was a successor to the throne of Doong Doong Island, but he decided royalty was not for him.{{Cite web|url=https://store.kakaofriends.com/en/etc/charInfo|title=The Kakao Friends Lovable Characters with Life-Sized Personalities|website=KAKAO FRIENDS ONLINE STORE|access-date=2018-11-05}} A lot of people misunderstand him because of his expressionless face, but he’s the trustworthy mentor who has delicate emotions.{{Cite news|url=https://brunch.co.kr/@tuxi0123/4|title=카카오 ‘라이언’ 디자이너를 만나다|date=2016-07-06|work=brunch|access-date=2017-05-30|language=ko}}{{Cite web|url=http://mengnews.joins.com/view.aspx?aId=3038838|title=Ryan the maneless lion brings in big bucks|website=Korea JoongAng Daily|access-date=2017-11-08}} == Products == === Introduction === Since Kakao Friend's character products have been growing mainly in the market of Kidult culture, Kakao Friends officials stated that they will make character goods by paying attention to these parts.{{Cite news|url=http://www.the-pr.co.kr/news/articleView.html?idxno=12992|title=‘카톡개’ 힘받은 다음카카오, 캐릭터 사업 확 키운다 - 더피알|access-date=2017-05-30|language=ko}} === Distribution === In July 2014, the Daum Kakao partnered with [[Samlip Food]] and launched four kinds of "Shanni Kakao Friends Bread". In the early four species, there were about 130 kinds of sticky cacao friends' strips. In February 2015, they launched a brand of toothpaste with Kakao friend characters on it, in collaboration with LG H & H. An industry official stated that although they had put their company's character on children's products before, this was the first attempt to put their characters on adult products. === Foods === In May 2015, [[Burger King]] collaborated with Kakao Friends and offered a Kakao Friend Doll if one made an order for more than a certain price in the store. [8] [[Baskin Robbins]] has also sold ice cream cakes that featured Apeach and Muzi's faces.{{Cite web|url=http://www.edaily.co.kr/news/NewsRead.edy?SCD=JC21&newsid=02663366609367936&DCD=A00302&OutLnkChk=Y|title=식품 프랜차이즈, 캐릭터 활용 마케팅 `봇물`|last=무단전재|first=Ⓒ 종합 경제정보 미디어 이데일리-상업적|last2=금지|first2=재배포|date=2015-05-11|website=edaily|access-date=2017-05-30}} === Game === In August 2015, the Daum Kakao launched 'Friend's Pop', the first mobile game that utilized the Kakao Friend character, and launched 'Friends Run', the sequel, in May 2016. Both games were rated top 10 in the Google Play sales.{{Cite news|url=http://www.hankyung.com/news/app/newsview.php?aid=201605316100v|title='프렌즈런'도 Top10 진입… 카카오프렌즈 연타석 홈런|date=2016-05-31|work=hankyung.com|access-date=2017-05-30|language=ko}} === Finance === In November 2014, the Daum Kakao collaborated with Woori Bank to launch the 'Woori Bank Wallet Kakao Bankbook', a design account book with a bank account and a Kakao friends character account.{{Cite web|url=http://www.fntimes.com/paper/view.aspx?num=135084|title=우리·하나 ‘뱅크월렛카카오’ 앞선 출시|last=FNTIMES|website=한국금융신문|access-date=2017-05-30}} In June 2015, in conjunction with Hana Card, KakaoPay's exclusive check card was launched using the Kakao Friend character.{{Cite web|url=http://www.viva100.com/main/view.php?key=20150603010000630|title=다음카카오, 카카오프렌즈 담은 ‘하나 체크카드’ 출시|website=100세시대의 동반자 브릿지경제|language=ko|access-date=2017-05-30}} == Friends shop == Beginning in Sinchon in April 2014, the company opened a store in the form of a pop-up store in major department stores in major cities such as Daegu and Busan, and several stores were established as regular stores. In addition to the character products sold in stores, KaKao Friends characters are used in collaboration with other companies in other fields.{{Cite web|url=https://store.kakaofriends.com/en/index|title=KAKAO FRIENDS|website=store.kakaofriends.com|language=en|access-date=2017-05-30}} == See also == * [[Line Friends]] * [[KakaoTalk]] ==References== {{Reflist}} == External links == * {{Official website|https://www.kakaofriends.com/en/index}} {{Kakao}} [[Category:Kakao]] [[Category:South Korean brands]] [[Category:Emoticons]] [[Category:Toy brands]] [[Category:Fictional characters introduced in 2012]]

|date=January 20, 2004}}</ref> *2005: Luiz Gê / Minami Keizi / Paulo Caruso<ref name="Reference2005">{{cite web |url=http://hqmaniacs.uol.com.br/21_Angelo_Agostini_confira_a_programacao_4020.html === Penciller === *1986: Watson Portela<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1987: Mozart Couto<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1988: Spacca<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1989: [[Laerte Coutinho]]<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1990: Gustavo Machado<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1991: Hector Gomez<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1992: Gustavo Machado / [[Lourenço Mutarelli]]<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1993: Marcelo Campos<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1994: Marcelo Campos<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1995: Fernando Gonsales<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1996: Arthur Garcia<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1997: Sebastião Seabra<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1998: Marcelo Campos<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1999: [[Laerte Coutinho]]<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *2000: Marcelo Campos<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *2001: Flávio Colin<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *2002: Flávio Colin<ref name="Reference2002" /> *2003: Júlio Shimamoto<ref name="Reference2003" /> *2004: Mozart Couto<ref name="Reference2004" /> *2005: Wanderley Felipe<ref name="Reference2005" /> *2006: [[Fábio Moon]] and [[Gabriel Bá]]<ref name="Reference2006" /> *2007: [[Fábio Moon]] and [[Gabriel Bá]]<ref name="Reference2007" /> *2008: [[Laudo Ferreira Jr.]]<ref name="Reference2008" /> *2009: [[Laudo Ferreira Jr.]]<ref name="Reference2009" /> *2010: Adauto Silva<ref name="Reference2010" /> *2011: Hélcio Rogério<ref name="Reference2011" /> *2012: Maurílio DNA<ref name="Reference2012" /> *2013: [[Danilo Beyruth]]<ref name="Reference2013" /> *2014: Shiko<ref name="Reference2014" /> *2015: [[Mario Cau]]<ref name="Reference2015" /> *2016: Di Amorim<ref name="Reference2016" /> *2017: Mary Cagnin<ref name="Reference2017" /> *2018: [[Mario Cau]]<ref name="Reference2018" />

=== New release === *1986: ''Chiclete com Banana'', by [[Angeli (cartoonist)|Angeli]] (Circo) / ''Revista Medo'', by many authors (Press)<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1987: ''Bundha'', by many authors (Press)<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1988: ''Radar'', by many authors (Press)<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1989: ''Seleções do Quadrix: Garra Cinzenta'', by Francisco Armond and Renato Silva (Waz)<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1990: ''[[O Menino Maluquinho|Menino Maluquinho]]'', by many authors (Abril)<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1991: ''Piratas do Tietê'', by [[Laerte Coutinho]] (Circo)<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1992: ''[[Os Trapalhões#Comics|Graphic Trapa]]'', by many authors (Abril)<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1993: ''Pau-Brasil'', by many authors (Vidente)<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1994: ''SemiDeuses'', by Alessandro A. Librandi and Walter Jr. (Saga)<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1995: ''Mulher-Diaba no Rastro de Lampião'', by Ataíde Braz and Flavio Colin (Nova Sampa)<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1996: ''Coleção Assombração'', by many authors (Ediouro)<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1997: ''[[List of Monica's Gang printed media|Gibizão da Turma da Mônica]]'', by many authors (Globo)<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1998: ''Metal Pesado'', by many authors (Metal Pesado)<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1999: ''Cybercomix'', by many authors (Bookmakers)<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *2000: ''O Dobro de Cinco'', by [[Lourenço Mutarelli]] (Devir)<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *2001: ''Fawcett'', by [[André Diniz]] and Flavio Colin (Nona Arte)<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *2002: ''Fábrica de Quadrinhos 2001'', by many authors (Devir)<ref name="Reference2002" /> *2003: ''Madame Satã'', by Luiz Antonio Aguiar e Júlio Shimamoto (Opera Graphica)<ref name="Reference2003" /> *2004: ''Roko-Loko e Adrina-Lina'', by Marcio Baraldi (Opera Graphica)<ref name="Reference2004" /> *2005: ''Roko-Loko e Adrina-Lina Atacam Novamente'', by Marcio Baraldi (Opera Graphica)<ref name="Reference2005" /> *2006: ''Tattoo Zinho'', by Marcio Baraldi (Opera Graphica)<ref name="Reference2006" /> *2007: ''Katita - Tiras Sem Preconceito'', by Anita Costa Prado and Ronaldo Mendes (Marca de Fantasia)<ref name="Reference2007" /> *2008: ''Menino Caranguejo'', by Chicolam (Splinter Comics)<ref name="Reference2008" /> *2009: ''Menina Infinito'', by Fábio Lyra (Desiderata)<ref name="Reference2009" /> *2010: ''Roko-Loko - Hey Ho, Let's Go!'', by Marcio Brandi (Rock Brigade)<ref name="Reference2010" /> *2011: ''Bando de dois'', by [[Danilo Beyruth]] (Zarabatana)<ref name="Reference2011" /> *2012: ''Ação Magazine'', by many authors (Lancaster)<ref name="Reference2012" /> *2013: ''[[Astronauta - Magnetar]]'', by [[Danilo Beyruth]] (Panini)<ref name="Reference2013" /> *2014: ''Meninos e Dragões'', by Lucio Luiz and Flavio Soares (Abril)<ref name="Reference2014" /> *2015: ''Yeshuah - Onde tudo está'', by [[Laudo Ferreira Jr.]] (Devir)<ref name="Reference2015" /> *2016: ''Valkíria - A fonte da juventude'', by Alex Mir and Alex Genaro (Draco)<ref name="Reference2016" /> *2017: ''Spectrus - Paralisia do Sono'', by Thiago Spyked (Crás)<ref name="Reference2017" /> *2018: ''Labirinto'', by Thiago Souto (Mino)<ref name="Reference2018" />
=== Jayme Cortez Trophy === *1988: Marcatti<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1989: Jal and Gualberto<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1990: Franco de Rosa<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1991: Franco de Rosa<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1992: Worney Almeida de Souza<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1993: Gibiteca Henfil<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1994: Edgard Guimarães<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1995: Edgard Guimarães<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1996: Edgard Guimarães<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1997: Edgard Guimarães<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1998: Editora Metal Pesado<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1999: Editora Bookmakers<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *2000: Edgard Guimarães<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *2001: Edgard Guimarães<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *2002: Editora Opera Graphica<ref name="Reference2002" /> *2003: Editora Opera Graphica<ref name="Reference2003" /> *2004: [[André Diniz]] / Sidney Gusman / Editora Opera Graphica<ref name="Reference2004" /> *2005: Roberto Guedes<ref name="Reference2005" /> *2006: Bigorna.net<ref name="Reference2006" /> *2007: Edgard Guimarães<ref name="Reference2007" /> *2008: Eloyr Pacheco<ref name="Reference2008" /> *2009: Coletivo Quarto Mundo<ref name="Reference2009" /> *2010: José Salles<ref name="Reference2010" /> *2011: José Salles<ref name="Reference2011" /> *2012: [[Festival Internacional de Quadrinhos]]<ref name="Reference2012" /> *2013: Gibicon Curitiba<ref name="Reference2013" /> *2014: Sidney Gusman<ref name="Reference2014" /> *2015: Confraria do Gibi<ref name="Reference2015" /> *2016: Gibiteca de Santos<ref name="Reference2016" /> *2017: Ivan Freitas da Costa<ref name="Reference2017" /> *2018: Fabio Tatsubô<ref name="Reference2018" />
=== Fanzine === *1993: ''Panacea''<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1994: ''Panacea''<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1995: ''Marvel News''<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1996: ''Informativo de Quadrinhos Independentes''<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1997: ''Informativo de Quadrinhos Independentes''<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1998: ''Informativo de Quadrinhos Independentes''<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *1999: ''Mocinhos e Bandidos''<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *2000: ''Quadrinhos Independentes''<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *2001: ''Quadrinhos Independentes''<ref name="Reference1985-2001" /> *2002: ''Quadrinhos Independentes''<ref name="Reference2002" /> *2003: ''Quadrinhos Independentes''<ref name="Reference2003" /> *2004: ''Quadrinhos Independentes''<ref name="Reference2004" /> *2005: ''Quadrinhos Independentes''<ref name="Reference2005" /> *2006: ''Quadrinhos Independentes''<ref name="Reference2006" /> *2007: ''Justiça Eterna''<ref name="Reference2007" /> *2008: ''Justiça Eterna''<ref name="Reference2008" /> *2009: ''Quadrinhos Independentes''<ref name="Reference2009" /> *2010: ''QI''<ref name="Reference2010" /> *2011: ''QI''<ref name="Reference2011" /> *2012: ''Miséria''<ref name="Reference2012" /> *2013: ''Quadrante Sul''<ref name="Reference2013" /> *2014: ''Quadrinhos Ácidos''<ref name="Reference2014" /> *2015: ''3ADFZPA - Terceiro Anuário de Fanzines, Zines e Publicações alternativas''<ref name="Reference2015" /> *2016: ''Peibê''<ref name="Reference2016" /> *2017: ''Café Ilustrado''<ref name="Reference2017" /> *2018: ''Tchê''<ref name="Reference2018" />
=== Cartoonist === *2003: Cláudio / Spacca / Marcio Baraldi / Lupin / Bira Dantas<ref name="Reference2003" /> *2004: Bira Dantas / Marcio Baraldi<ref name="Reference2004" /> *2005: Marcio Baraldi<ref name="Reference2005" /> *2006: Bira Dantas<ref name="Reference2006" /> *2007: Marcio Baraldi<ref name="Reference2007" /> *2008: Marcio Baraldi<ref name="Reference2008" /> *2009: Marcio Baraldi<ref name="Reference2009" /> *2010: Sivanildo Sill<ref name="Reference2010" /> *2011: Marcio Baraldi<ref name="Reference2011" /> *2012: [[Gustavo Duarte]]<ref name="Reference2012" /> *2013: Jean Galvão<ref name="Reference2013" /> *2014: [[Angeli (cartoonist)|Angeli]]<ref name="Reference2014" /> *2015: DaCosta<ref name="Reference2015" /> *2016: Brum<ref name="Reference2016" /> *2017: Carlos Henrique Guabiras<ref name="Reference2017" /> *2018: Guilherme Bandeira<ref name="Reference2018" />
=== New independent release === *2011: ''Lucas da Vila de Sant'anna da Feira'', by Marcos Franco, Marcelo Lima and Hélcio Rogério<ref name="Reference2011" /> *2012: ''Love Hurts'', by Murilo Martins<ref name="Reference2012" /> *2013: ''Last RPG Fantasy'', by Yoshi Itice, Marcel Keiiche and Kendy Saito<ref name="Reference2013" /> *2014: ''Plataforma HQ'', by many authors<ref name="Reference2014" /> *2015: ''Nenhum dia sem um traço'', by Ernani Cousandier<ref name="Reference2015" /> *2016: ''Nos bastidores da Bíblia - Êxodo'', by Carlos Ruas and Leonardo Maciel<ref name="Reference2016" /> *2017: ''Protocolo: A Ordem'', by Thiago da Silva Mota and Ton Marx<ref name="Reference2017" /> *2018: ''Bilhetes'', by many authors<ref name="Reference2018" />
=== Webcomic === *2015: ''Blue e os Gatos'', by Paulo Kielwagen<ref name="Reference2015" /> *2016: ''Nuvens de Verão'', by Charles Lindberg and Israel de Oliveira<ref name="Reference2016" /> *2017: ''Marco e Seus Amigos'', by Tako X and Alessandra Freitas<ref name="Reference2017" /> *2018: ''Na Mira da Lena'', by Luciano Freitas<ref name="Reference2018" />
== Former categories ==
=== Art-technique (colorist and letterer) === *2003: Alexandre Silva / Lilian Mitsunaga / [[André Vazzios]] / André Hernandez / Alexandre Jubran<ref name="Reference2003" /> *2004: Alexandre Jubran / [[André Vazzios]]<ref name="Reference2004" />

revision.text:
[[File:Codex Manesse Walther von der Vogelweide.jpg|thumb|[[Walther von der Vogelweide]] ([[Codex Manesse]], ca. 1300)]]
'''Minnesang''' ({{IPA-de|ˈmɪnəˌzaŋ|lang}}, "love song") was a tradition of lyric- and song-writing in Germany that flourished in the [[Medieval German literature#Middle High German|Middle High German period]]. This period of [[medieval German literature]] began in the 12th century and continued into the 14th. People who wrote and performed {{Lang|de|Minnesang}} were known as '''Minnesänger''' ({{IPA-de|ˈmɪnəˌzɛŋɐ|lang}}, ''minnesingers''), and a single song was called a '''{{Lang|de|Minnelied}}'''.
The name derives from ''[[wikt:Minne#German|minne]]'', the [[Middle High German]] word for love, as that was Minnesang's main subject. The ''Minnesänger'' were similar to the [[Occitan language|Provençal]] [[troubadour]]s and northern [[French language|French]] ''[[trouvère]]s'' in that they wrote love poetry in the tradition of [[courtly love]] in the [[High Middle Ages]].
==Social status== In the absence of reliable biographical information, there has been debate about the social status of the ''{{Lang|de|Minnesänger}}''. Some clearly belonged to the higher [[nobility]] – the 14th century [[Codex Manesse]] includes songs by dukes, counts, kings, and the Emperor [[Henry VI, Holy Roman Emperor|Henry VI]]. Some ''Minnesänger'', as indicated by the title ''[[Meister]]'' (master), were clearly educated commoners, such as Meister [[Konrad von Würzburg]]. It is thought that many were ''[[ministerialis|ministeriales]]'', that is, members of a class of lower nobility, [[vassal]]s of the great lords. Broadly speaking, the ''Minnesänger'' were writing and performing for their own social class at court, and should be thought of as courtiers rather than professional hired musicians. [[Friedrich von Hausen]], for example, was part of the entourage of [[Friedrich Barbarossa]], and died on crusade. As a reward for his service, [[Walther von der Vogelweide]] was given a [[fief]] by the Emperor [[Frederick II, Holy Roman Emperor|Frederick II]].
Several of the best known Minnesänger are also noted for their epic poetry, among them [[Heinrich von Veldeke]], [[Wolfram von Eschenbach]] and [[Hartmann von Aue]].
==History== The earliest texts date from perhaps 1150, and the earliest named Minnesänger are [[Der von Kürenberg]] and [[Dietmar von Aist]], clearly writing in a native German tradition in the third quarter of the 12th century. This is referred to as the Danubian tradition.
From around 1170, German lyric poets came under the influence of the Provençal [[troubadour]]s and the French ''[[trouvère]]s''. This is most obvious in the adoption of the [[strophic form]] of the ''[[canzone]]'', at its most basic a seven-line strophe with the rhyme scheme ab|ab|cxc, and a musical AAB structure, but capable of many variations.
A number of songs from this period match ''trouvère'' originals exactly in form, indicating that the German text could have been sung to an originally French tune, which is especially likely where there are significant commonalities of content. Such songs are termed [[contrafacta]]. For example, [[Friedrich von Hausen]]'s "Ich denke underwilen" is regarded as a contrafactum of [[Guiot de Provins]]'s "Ma joie premeraine".
By around 1190, the German poets began to break free of Franco-Provençal influence. This period is regarded as the period of Classical Minnesang with [[Albrecht von Johansdorf]], [[Heinrich von Morungen]], [[Reinmar von Hagenau]] developing new themes and forms, reaching its culmination in [[Walther von der Vogelweide]], regarded both in the Middle Ages and in the present day as the greatest of the Minnesänger.
The later Minnesang, from around 1230, is marked by a partial turning away from the refined ethos of classical minnesang and by increasingly elaborate formal developments. The most notable of these later ''Minnesänger'', [[Neidhart von Reuental]] introduces characters from lower social classes and often aims for humorous effects.
==Melodies== Only a small number of Minnelied melodies have survived to the present day, mainly in manuscripts dating from the 15th century or later, which may present the songs in a form other than the original one. Additionally, it is often rather difficult to interpret the [[musical notation]] used to write them down. Although the contour of the [[melody]] can usually be made out, the [[rhythm]] of the song is frequently hard to fathom.
There are a number of recordings of Minnesang using the original melodies, as well as Rock groups such as [[Ougenweide]] performing songs with modern instruments.
==Later developments== In the 15th century, Minnesang developed into and gave way to the tradition of the [[Meistersinger|Meistersänger]]. The two traditions are quite different, however; Minnesänger were mainly aristocrats, while Meistersänger usually were commoners.
At least two [[opera]]s have been written about the Minnesang tradition: [[Richard Wagner]]'s ''[[Tannhäuser (opera)|Tannhäuser]]'' and [[Richard Strauss]]' ''[[Guntram]]''.
==Notable Minnesänger== ;Danubian Lyric *[[Dietmar von Aist]] *[[Der von Kürenberg]] *[[Meinloh von Sevelingen]]
;Early Courtly Lyric *[[Friedrich von Hausen]] *[[Henry VI, Holy Roman Emperor|Kaiser Heinrich VI]] *[[Heinrich von Veldeke]] *[[:de:Spervogel|Spervogel]]
;Classical Minnesang *[[Albrecht von Johansdorf]] *[[Bernger von Horheim]] *[[Gottfried von Strassburg]] *[[Hartmann von Aue]] (1160/1170–1210/1220) *[[Heinrich von Morungen]] *[[Reinmar von Hagenau]] (ca. 1210) *[[Walther von der Vogelweide]] *[[Wolfram von Eschenbach]]
;Later Minnesang: 13th century [[File:Botenlauben-Brunnen.JPG|thumb|Otto von Botenlauben Fountain]] *[[Reinmar von Brennenberg]] *[[Regenbogen (Spruchdichter)|der Regenboge]] *[[Friedrich von Sonnenburg]] *[[Gottfried von Neifen]] *[[Heinrich Frauenlob|Heinrich von Meissen (Frauenlob)]] (1250/1260–1318) *[[Hugo von Montfort]] *[[Konrad von Würzburg]] (1220/1230–1287) *[[Neidhart von Reuental]] (1st half of the 13th century) *[[Otto von Botenlauben]] (1177 – before 1245) *[[Reinmar von Zweter]] (1200 – after 1247) *[[Süßkind von Trimberg]] *Der [[Tannhäuser]] *[[Ulrich von Liechtenstein]] (ca. 1200–1275) *[[Walther von Klingen]] (1240–1286)
;Later Minnesang: 14th century *[[Johannes Hadlaub]] (End of 13th century – 1340) *[[Muskatblüt]] *[[Oswald von Wolkenstein]]
==Example of a Minnelied== The following love poem, of unknown authorship, is found in a Latin [[codex]] of the 12th century from the [[Tegernsee Abbey]]. {| !Middle High German !Modern German !English |- |<poem>Dû bist mîn, ich bin dîn: des solt dû gewis sîn. dû bist beslozzen in mînem herzen. verlorn ist das slüzzelîn: dû muost immer drinne sîn!</poem> |style="padding-left:2em;"|<poem>Du bist mein, ich bin dein: des(sen) sollst du gewiss sein. Du bist verschlossen in meinem Herzen. Verloren ist das Schlüsselein: du musst immer darin sein!</poem> |style="padding-left:2em;"|<poem>You are mine, I am yours, Thereof you may be certain. You're locked away within my heart. Lost is the key And you must ever be therein!</poem> |}
==Editions== The standard collections are *12th and early 13th Century Minnesang (up to Reinmar von Hagenau): **H. Moser, H. Tervooren, ''Des Minnesangs Frühling''. ***Vol. I: Texts, 38th edn (Hirzel, 1988) {{ISBN|3-7776-0448-8}} ***Vol II: Editorial Principles, Melodies, Manuscripts, Notes, 36th edn (Hirzel, 1977) {{ISBN|3-7776-0331-7}} ***Vol III: Commentaries (Hirzel, 2000) {{ISBN|3-7776-0368-6}} *13th Century Minnesang after Walther von der Vogelweide: **Carl v. Kraus, G. Kornrumpf, ''Deutsche Liederdichter des 13. Jahrhunderts'' (Niemeyer 1978) {{ISBN|3-484-10284-5}}. *14th and 15th centuries: **Thomas Cramer, ''Die kleineren Liederdichter des 14. und 15. Jhs.'', 4 Vols (Fink 1979-1985)
There are separate editions of Walther's works, and of a number of the most prolific Minnesänger. There are many published selections with Modern German translation.
==See also== *[[Liederhandschrift]]
==References== {{No footnotes|date=March 2010}} *Olive Sayce, ''The medieval German lyric, 1150-1300: the development of its themes and forms in their European context'' (Oxford University Press, 1982) {{ISBN|0-19-815772-X}} *Ronald J. Taylor, ''The Art of the Minnesinger. Songs of the thirteenth century transcribed and edited with textual and musical commentaries'' (University of Wales Press, 2 vols., 1968) *[[Alwin Schultz]], ''Das höfische Leben zur Zeit der Minnesinger'' (“Court life at the time of the Minnesinger,” 2 vols., 1889) *Barbara Garvey Seagrave and Wesley Thomas, ''The Songs of the Minnesingers. Includes LP record that presents songs of many of the principal minnesingers, with instruments of the period accompanying the vocalists'' (University of Illinois Press, 1966)
==External links== {{Wikisource1911Enc|Minnesingers}} *{{Commons category-inline|Minnesang}} *[https://books.google.com/books?id=sGQCAAAAQAAJ&printsec=frontcover&dq=minnesangs&hl=en&ei=Qy52TY29G463hAf_tYGBBw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CCcQ6AEwAA#v=onepage&q&f=false 1857 edition of Karl Lachmann] * Adolph Ernst Kroeger [https://books.google.com/books?id=2INbAAAAcAAJ&source=gbs_navlinks_s ''The Minnesinger of Germany''] 1873 * {{Cite NIE|wstitle=Minnesinger|short=x}} * {{Cite NSRW|wstitle=Minnesinger|short=x}} * {{Cite Collier's|wstitle=Minnesingers |short=x}}
{{Carmina Burana}}
